Equivalence test

Source: R/equivalence_test.R
equivalence_test.effectsize_table.Rd

Compute the equivalence test for frequentist models.

# S3 method for effectsize_table
equivalence_test(x, range = "default", ...)

Arguments

x

An effect size table, such as returned by cohens_d, eta_squared, F_to_r, etc.
range

The range of practical equivalence of an effect. If a single value is provided, the test is done against c(-range, range). For effect sizes that cannot be negative, the lower bound is set to 0. If "default", will be set to [-.1, .1].
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

Value

A data frame.

See also

For more details, see equivalence_test.

Examples


ds <- t_to_d(t = c(0.45, -0.65, -2.2, 2.25),
             df_error = c(675, 525, 900, 1875))
(equi <- equivalence_test(ds, range = 0.2))
#> # Test for Practical Equivalence
#> 
#>   ROPE: [-0.20 0.20]
#> 
#>     d |         95% CI |        H0
#> ----------------------------------
#>  0.03 | [-0.12,  0.19] |  Accepted
#> -0.06 | [-0.23,  0.11] | Undecided
#> -0.15 | [-0.28, -0.02] |  Rejected
#>  0.10 | [ 0.01,  0.19] |  Accepted
if (require(see)) plot(equi)
#> Loading required package: see


model <- aov(mpg ~ factor(am) * factor(cyl), data = mtcars)
es <- eta_squared(model)
(equi <- equivalence_test(es, range = 0.15))
#> # Test for Practical Equivalence
#> 
#>   ROPE: [0.00 0.15]
#> 
#> Parameter              | Eta_Sq_partial |       90% CI |        H0
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------
#> factor(am)             |           0.63 | [0.42, 0.75] |  Rejected
#> factor(cyl)            |           0.66 | [0.45, 0.77] |  Rejected
#> factor(am):factor(cyl) |           0.10 | [0.00, 0.27] | Undecided
if (require(see)) plot(equi)
